title: Work - work done by a quadratic force

content.question: An object is pushed along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis by a varying force <math alttext="F of x equals, b times x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is a constant. The force does work <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> on the object as it moves from <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="x equals D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>D</mi></math>. How much work does the varying force do on the object as it moves from <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="x equals 2 D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
